intro: Anneslia xalapensis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. Anneslia xalapensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
